glossary.definition: A formal assessment of an employee's performance over a specific period
A defined time period for conducting performance evaluations (e.g., annual, semi-annual, quarterly)
A stage in the evaluation process (e.g., self-assessment, manager review, calibration, finalization)
A person involved in the evaluation process (evaluator, evaluatee, reviewer)
An evaluation instance for a specific employee in a specific cycle

business_rules: Evaluations must be associated with an evaluation cycle
Evaluation cycles have defined start and end dates
Employees can only have one active evaluation per cycle
Evaluation phases must be completed in sequence
Participants must be assigned appropriate roles (evaluator, evaluatee, reviewer)
Evaluation forms must be completed before phase transition
Evaluation completion requires all required phases to be finished
Evaluations can be reopened for corrections within defined time window
Evaluation history must be maintained for audit purposes
Multi-rater evaluations require multiple evaluators to complete
calculations_or_formulas: Average evaluation score = sum of all criteria scores / number of criteria
invariants: Evaluation must be associated with valid employee and cycle
Evaluation phases must be completed in order
Participant roles must be valid and assigned
Evaluation cannot be completed without all required phases finished
Evaluation cycle dates must be valid (start < end)
edge_cases: Employee is terminated mid-evaluation - system handles partial evaluation, may close or complete based on policy
Evaluator is unavailable - system allows reassignment or extension of phase deadline
Evaluation phase deadline is missed - system flags overdue, sends reminders, may auto-advance with default values
Evaluation is reopened for correction - system maintains history, allows edits within time window
Multiple evaluators provide conflicting scores - system flags discrepancies, may require calibration or manager review
Evaluation cycle is extended - system updates deadlines, notifies participants, adjusts phase timelines
Employee changes roles mid-cycle - system handles role change, may require new evaluation or continuation
Evaluation data is corrupted - system maintains backups, allows recovery from last valid state
compliance_requirements: Evaluation data must be retained for legal compliance (typically 7 years)
Evaluation history must be immutable once finalized
Participant access must be logged for audit purposes
Evaluation corrections must be documented with reason and approver
Evaluation cycles must comply with company policies and labor regulations
user_journeys: HR creates evaluation cycle - defines period, phases, and participants, cycle is active
System creates evaluation applications - one per employee in cycle, participants are notified
Employee completes self-assessment - fills evaluation form, submits, phase is marked complete
Manager reviews employee evaluation - provides feedback and scores, submits review
Evaluation goes through calibration - scores are reviewed and adjusted if needed
Evaluation is finalized - all phases complete, evaluation is closed, results are communicated
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given evaluation cycle creation, when period and phases are defined, then cycle is created and evaluations are generated
Given evaluation application, when employee is in cycle, then application is created and participants are notified
Given phase completion, when all required forms are submitted, then phase is marked complete and next phase is activated
Given evaluation finalization, when all phases are complete, then evaluation is finalized and results are communicated
Given evaluation correction, when correction is approved, then evaluation is updated and history is maintained
open_questions: What are the specific evaluation phases? (self-assessment, manager review, calibration, finalization?)
How are evaluation scores calculated? (average? weighted? criteria-based?)
What happens when evaluation deadline is missed? (auto-advance? extension? default scores?)
How are multi-rater evaluations handled? (360-degree? peer reviews? upward feedback?)
What is the process for evaluation corrections? (time window? approval required?)
How are evaluation cycles configured? (annual? quarterly? custom periods?)
assumptions: Evaluation cycles are defined at organizational or department level
Evaluation phases must be completed sequentially
Participants have specific roles and permissions
Evaluation forms are customizable per cycle or role
Evaluation history is maintained for audit and reporting
